hints.content: The mass of the monkey is $\greenD{270}$ grams.
The mass of the fox is $\purpleD{230}$ grams.

We can find how much greater the mass of the monkey is by subtracting the mass of the fox $(\purpleD{230}\text{ g})$ from the mass of the monkey $(\greenD{270}\text { g})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 270 grams. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Monkey. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 230 grams. The shorter right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Fox. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Difference. !

hints.content: The monkey's mass is $40$ grams greater than the fox's mass.

question.content:
Every Monday a zoo finds the mass of its animals.   
 
This Monday, the zookeeper measured the monkey and the fox first (shown below).

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How much greater is the mass of the monkey than the fox?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] grams

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a monkey with a starting major tick mark of 0 grams and the additional 7 major tick marks labeled 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300, and 350. There are 4 minor unlabeled tick marks between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the monkey on the scale is at the second minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 250. !

A hanging scale weighing a fox with a starting major tick mark of 0 grams and the additional 7 major tick marks labeled 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300, and 350. There are 4 minor unlabeled tick marks between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the fox on the scale is at the third minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 200. !
